hero.title: About Derek
hero.subtitle: Design systems and UX leader focused on complex, data-heavy products.

intro.body: Over the last two decades I’ve led enterprise UI modernization, built design systems like Paylocity’s Citrus, and shipped products like Modern Workforce Index that turn noisy signals into explainable decisions. Today, most of my systems work shows up in OODS Foundry and in client programs through System.Systems.

items.title: Enterprise UX & design systems
items.body: Align multi-product platforms around tokens, components, and patterns governed by clear contracts—not just Figma libraries.

items.title: Object-oriented UX & canonical models
items.body: Define user, organization, product, and subscription objects (and the traits that shape them) so product teams, analytics, and agents can all rely on the same source of truth.

items.title: AI-era workflows
items.body: Treat AI as a co-creator and maintainer, not a replacement—linting traits, checking token coverage and accessibility, and keeping systems in sync while humans provide taste and judgment.

items.title: Leadership & enablement
items.body: Grow teams, set ladders and contribution models, and connect design-system work to outcomes that matter to executives: delivery velocity, quality, and trust.

items.title: Systems first
items.body: Start from objects, relationships, and constraints; let components and screens fall out of that structure.

items.title: Evidence over aesthetics alone
items.body: Research, metrics, and operational realities shape the system as much as brand.

items.title: Explainability as a requirement
items.body: From organizational scores to permissions models, people should understand why something changed—not just that it did.

items.title: Humans in the loop
items.body: Use agents to maintain and audit systems; keep humans responsible for taste, judgment, and trade-offs.

items.title: Production-minded
items.body: Prefer working proofs over slideware; prototypes use real data, real flows, and are designed to be hardened, not thrown away.
